title.value: Продуктивность коров, энергия роста телят в зависимости от качества воды и нормативов водопотребления при интенсивном производстве молока и говядины
Efficiency of cows, energy of calf growth depending on water quality and specifications of water consumption at intensive manufacture of milk and a beef
Efficiency of cows, energy of calf growth depending on water quality and specifications of water consumption at intensive manufacture of milk and a beef

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Brylo, I.V., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were determined features of the water supply to cattle farms, the water quality of water sources and its effect on the body of animals, based and developed standards for water use in the intensive technology of production of milk and beef. Artesian wells of deep drilling 24, 32 and 80 m located in a zone of cattle-breeding buildings and outside of it on distance from 60 up to 120 m were used as objects of the research. Besides, there was considered quality of water from the open reservoirs (mine wells). For a complex of beef manufacture there were established the following norms of water consumption without taking into account on a leak of drinking bowls: in the first period (calves of 20-85-days age) - 12 liter/head a day, including on watering 6,1 (50,8 %); in the second period (calves of 3-5 months of age) - 21 liter/head a day, including watering 12,5 (57,3 %); in the third period (young growth 6-17,5 months) - 19,2 liter/head a day, including watering - (65,6 %). Consumption of water by cows of different efficiency is influenced also with a way of the maintenance of animals (tied and loose housing system). At cows loose housing system the consumption of water was more significant.
